alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 4:09AM PST until March 04 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches, except a trace to less than an inch below 700 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia. In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Greater Vancouver Area. Elevations above 700 feet. * WHEN...Until noon PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to be 500 and 1000 feet late through Saturday morning. This means the most likely outcome for the lower elevations is a dusting at most.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County
